page.title: 18MARCHER SOUND/GWERSYLLT
page.content: {Marcher Sound}is an independant local radio station.It covers north and east Wales,Cheshire and Shropshire this being the border area gives rise to its name.This area,many centuries ago,was known as the Welsh Marches. The station was opened in 1983 by Lord Evans of Claughton(Chairman). It employs about 25 people and are at present in the process of merging with Radio City(Liverpool). From the 35,000 records in their archives the daily programmes are compiled.The programmes can include interviews,competitions,phone-ins,etc. Income is derived from advertisement revenue and advertisements are allocated a maximun of 9 minutes per hour. There are 3 recording studios from which programmes are broadcast.
